excerpt: Basic menagerie with outdoor exhibits of elephants, crocodiles, large birds & other animals
detail_description: Kurumbapatty Zoological Park is an ideal destination for families and couples who want to spend half a day enjoying the outdoors. The park features outdoor exhibits of elephants, crocodiles, large birds, and other animals that children will surely love. Additionally, the park has a kid's area and an electric car to tour around. The entrance fee is affordable, and maintenance of the park is good. Visitors should bring ample water in metal bottles as no plastics are allowed inside the premises.
name: Kurumbapatty Zoological Park
address: Zoology Park Road, Chinnakollapatty, Salem, Kurumbampatti, Tamil Nadu 636008, India

detail_description: Situated on the picturesque banks of river Tirumanimutthar, Kottai Mariamman Temple is a revered pilgrimage site in Salem. Dedicated to Goddess Kottai Mariamman, it holds the distinction of being one of the oldest temples in the city.
name: kottai mariamman temple
address: M35R+82, Selathampatty, Sithanur, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636302, India

excerpt: Hindu temple complex dedicated to Shiva, with 1008 identical Nandi statues arrayed over a hillside.
detail_description: The 1008 Shiva Temple in Salem is a Hindu temple complex dedicated to Shiva, featuring an array of 1008 identical Nandi statues carved from stone. The main highway runs close by, but the temple can only be reached at the top of the hill. In addition to the impressive lingas and nandis, there are also other allied group temples such as Perumal Temple.
name: 1008 Shiva & Rajarajeshwari Temple Salem
address: H3WJ+Q6Q, Srinagar - Kanyakumari Hwy, Ariyanur, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636308, India

excerpt: Centuries-old temple dedicated to a rain goddess, host to the major annual Aadi festival in August.
detail_description: The Sri Kottai Mariamman Koil is a centuries-old Hindu temple in Salem that is dedicated to the rain goddess. It is renowned for hosting the annual Aadi festival in August and is one of the most famous temples in the city. The main temple is currently undergoing renovation, but there is a temporary location on the same premises where visitors can worship a small and adorable statue.
name: Arulmigu Sri Kottai Mariamman Temple
address: M535+MMM, Fairlands Main Rd, I Agraharam, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636001, India

detail_description: The ISKCON Temple in Salem, currently under construction, is a sacred site dedicated to the worship of Radha and Krishna. The temple project is grand and incorporates ancient architectural science with spiritual, educational, and cultural elements. Despite being under construction, the present facilities are impressive with features like real mural paintings on the walls and daily worship from early morning until late evening. The temple exudes a strong spiritual vibe that offers inner peace and tranquility.
name: ISKCON Temple
address: Hare Krishna Land, Vellakalpatti, Karuppur, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636012, India

excerpt: Lake backed by forested peaks & dotted by artificial islands, with waterside trails & rich birdlife.
name: Mookaneri
address: M5PH+MVJ, Kannankurichi Main Rd, Kannankurichi, M.Palapatti, Tamil Nadu 636008, India

name: Signal Bosti Nroth Jama Masjid
address: M47W+PCJ, Parvathipuram, Indian Bank Colony, Arisipalayam, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636009, India

detail_description: Bears Cave Bar is one of the best bars in Yercaud, located amidst a plethora of tourist attractions such as Yercaud Lake, Loop Road, Pagoda Point, and Kiliyur Waterfall. The bar is known for its friendly staff and budget-friendly offerings. It's a great place to unwind after exploring the magical charm of Yercaud's natural wonders and tourist spots.
name: BEARS CAVE BAR
address: No.01,Hospital road, hills, near SHEVAROYS COMPLEX, Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

detail_description: Karadi Siddhar Temple, also known as Kandhasramam, is a temple complex located 5 km from Salem city. Situated at the northern end of Jarugu Malai Mountain, it was built in 1970-71 by Santhanandha Brahmendra Sarasvathi Adhyavadhutha Swamy.
name: Karadi Siddhar Temple
address: J472+F55, Uthamasolapuram, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636010, India

detail_description: Montfort School-ICSE/ANGLO INDIAN is a renowned educational institution in Yercaud, with a rich history dating back to 1917. The school's colonial architecture and picturesque surroundings make it a unique spot to visit, featuring beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Founded by the Irish Brothers, the campus is aesthetically appealing and offers visitors the opportunity to admire its architecture through guided tours.
name: Montfort School-ICSE/ANGLO INDIAN
address: Q6F6+25Q, Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636602, India

excerpt: Yercaud is a hill station town in the south Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It lies in the Shevaroy Hills, known for their orange groves, and coffee, fruit and spice plantations. Yercaud Lake has a boathouse, and is surrounded by gardens and woods. On the lake’s eastern shore, Anna Park has local plants and a Japanese garden with bonsai. To the southwest, Lady’s Seat vantage point has a watchtower with a telescope.
detail_description: Yercaud, a charming hill station town in Tamil Nadu, is nestled in the Shevaroy Hills and is famous for its orange groves, coffee plantations, and spice gardens. The town boasts the picturesque Yercaud Lake with a boathouse and surrounded by lush gardens and woods. Visitors can explore Anna Park with its local flora and Japanese garden or head to Lady's Seat vantage point for stunning views from the watchtower. With an area of 382.
name: Yercaud
address: Tamil Nadu 636601, India

excerpt: Salem is a city on the Thirumanimuthar River, in the south Indian state of Tamil Nadu. The centuries-old Sugavaneswarar Temple, dedicated to the Hindu deity Shiva, features colorful gopurams (towers) and gardens. Nearby, colonial-era Christ Church is an Indo-Saracenic landmark consecrated in 1875. Jamiya Masjid is a mosque believed to have been built by Tipu Sultan, the 18th-century ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore.
detail_description: Salem, a city in Tamil Nadu, India, is home to the ancient Sugavaneswarar Temple dedicated to the Hindu deity Shiva and adorned with vibrant gopurams and lush gardens. The colonial-era Christ Church, built in 1875, stands as an Indo-Saracenic marvel nearby. Additionally, the historic Jamiya Masjid mosque is believed to have been constructed by Tipu Sultan.
name: Salem
address: Tamil Nadu, India

name: Sugavaneshwarar Temple Pond
address: Salem, Tamil Nadu 636001

detail_description: Pagoda Point in Yercaud is a must-visit spot offering breathtaking panoramic views of the hills, valleys, and Salem city. The serene atmosphere makes it perfect for relaxation and capturing stunning photographs. This viewpoint is adorned with a special pagoda-style building, adding to its charm. While it can get crowded on weekends, visitors can enjoy food stalls, wooden toy vendors, and even balloon shooting.
name: Pagoda Point | Yercaud
address: Q68Q+GH9, Yercaud Talai cholai, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

detail_description: Lady's Seat Children's Park is a popular tourist spot in Yercaud, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. It is a cluster of rocks on the southwest of the Yercaud hills, providing an overlook of the ghat road and Salem town to the south. The area features a natural rock formation resembling a seat, where it is said that an English lady used to spend her evenings admiring the panoramic scenery.
name: Lady's Seat Children's Park
address: Q5CX+8H6, Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

name: Kottai Mariamman Temple
address: H3C7+C9M, Kakkayan street, South, Salem, Tamil Nadu, India

excerpt: Museum featuring archaeological artifacts & historical objects from the Salem region.
name: Government Museum
address: No. 2, Balaji Nagar Layout, Sarada College Rd, Fairlands, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636016, India

name: Ayodhyapattanam
address: Varaterikadu, Mettupattitadanur, Ayothiapattinam, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636103, India

excerpt: Famous garden featuring a large number of rose varieties in a carefully landscaped space.
detail_description: Yercaud Rose Garden is a must-visit for flower enthusiasts, boasting a wide array of rose varieties in a meticulously designed setting. The garden offers a serene atmosphere with its walkways, seating areas, and a charming artificial fountain. Visitors can also explore the small nursery to take home rose saplings. Located on Lady's Seat road, this attraction is maintained by the southern circle of Botanical Survey of India and houses an assortment of exotic flowers and plants.
name: Yercaud Rose Garden
address: Q6F2+8HF, Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

detail_description: Located just 3 km from Emerald Lake, the Botanical Garden in Yercaud is a serene spot for nature enthusiasts. While smaller than its namesake in Ooty, it boasts a variety of plant species and well-kept paths for leisurely strolls. Visitors can admire the lush flora, including an orchid garden and greenhouse, while enjoying views of Yercaud's streets, coffee estates, and gardens from watch towers.
name: Govt. Botanical Garden - Yercaud
address: 30/68, Ondikadai, Salem - Yercaud Ghat Road, Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

name: Siddhar Kovil
address: J2CG+XX8, Siddhar Kovil Rd, Kanjamalai R.F., Tamil Nadu 636307, India

excerpt: Historic Shiva temple, over 500 years old, known for its soaring towers, quaint garden & festivals.
detail_description: Arulmigu Sugavaneswarar Swamy Temple is a Hindu temple with a rich history spanning over 500 years. It is renowned for its magnificent towers that rise high into the sky, as well as its charming gardens and vibrant festivals. This ancient temple serves as a religious center for many Hindus, drawing visitors from near and far to appreciate its unique architecture and cultural significance.
name: Sri Sugavaneswarar Swamy Temple
address: Mettu Agraharam, I Agraharam, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636001, India

name: Ellai Pidari Amman Temple
address: M546+967, I Agraharam, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636001, India

address: M52X+737, Salem - Ulundurpettai Hwy, Ammapet, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636015, India

name: Kandasramam Murugan Temple
address: Udayapatti, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636140, India

excerpt: Waterpark featuring slides, rides, a lazy river & other amusements, plus a food court.
detail_description: Paravasa Ulagam is an amusement park that boasts of water slides, rides, a lazy river and many other amusements. It also houses a food court where visitors can grab some delicious snacks. The entrance fee is inclusive of access to several water play games and amusement rides, making it a great value for money option. During the Pongal holidays, the water quality was excellent.
name: Paravasa Ulagam
address: Salem to Namakkal Highway, NH 44, KK Valasu, Mallur, Tamil Nadu 636203, India

detail_description: Sangagiri Fort, located just a short drive from Erode and Salem, is a captivating historical site surrounded by natural beauty. The trek through the lush jungle takes about 1 to 1.45 hours and offers breathtaking viewpoints, with the chance to spot monkeys along the way. It's best to embark on this adventure in the morning and with a group for safety. Visitors are advised to bring water and snacks as there are no amenities nearby.
name: Sankagiri Fort
address: FVH8+F26, Unnamed Road, VN Palayam, Sangagiri, Tamil Nadu 637301, India

name: Poi Maan Karadu
address: H4MW+MW8, Gajallnayakkanpatti, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636201, India

name: Silk World - Yercaud
address: Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

excerpt: Relaxed resort on a former coffee plantation offering a basic restaurant, a zipline & bird-watching.
detail_description: Grange Resort, located on a former coffee plantation, is a budget property in Yercaud offering standard facilities to guests. The castle-like building, built in the 1800s, adds to its historical charm. Situated close to popular attractions such as Yercaud Lake and Killiyur Falls, the resort provides a peaceful retreat. While the cottage size is modest and insects may be spotted due to its forest location, the attentive staff and excellent food enhance the overall experience.
name: Grange Resort , Yercaud.
address: Cock Burn Road, Five Roads, Yercaud, Tamil Nadu 636601, India

detail_description: This place is an excellent venue for worship, known as the Arulmigu Panduranganathar Temple. The temple authorities ensure the cleanliness of both the surrounding area and the water source within. The deities of gods and goddesses are beautifully adorned, creating a visually pleasing atmosphere. Visitors are encouraged to pay a visit to this serene temple and offer their prayers to experience positive times that may occur unexpectedly.
name: Arulmigu Sri Panduranganathar Temple
address: M532+63W, Manickam Pillai St, Shevapet, Salem, Tamil Nadu 636002, India
